text: Background : Time series methods are commonly used to detect disease outbreak signatures ( e . g . , signals due to influenza outbreaks and anthrax attacks ) from varying respiratory - related diagnostic or syndromic data sources . Typically this involves two components : ( i ) Using time series methods to model the baseline background distribution ( the time series process that is assumed to contain no outbreak signatures ) , ( ii ) Detecting outbreak signatures using filter - based time series methods .
